Somatic Variant Details - Potentially Ac.description: BCL11B encodes a C2H2-type zinc finger protein that functions as a transcriptional repressor and plays a role in T-cell development and survival. Loss of function mutations, copy number loss, and fusions resulting in the underexpression of BCL11B are associated with cancer progression.

PTEN encodes a phosphatase that acts as a tumor suppressor by negatively regulating the PI3K-AKT-mTOR pathway. Loss of function mutations, copy number loss, and underexpression of PTEN are associated with cancer progression.

TP53 encodes a protein that is a transcription factor that regulates the expression of genes involved in cell cycle arrest, apoptosis, and DNA repair. TP53 is a tumor suppressor gene that is mutated in many cancers. Mutations in TP53 are associated with cancer progression.

Somatic Variant Details - Biologically R.description: ARID2 encodes a protein that is a subunit of the SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling complex SWI/SNF-B or PBAF. This complex functions in ligand-dependent transcriptional activation. Loss of function mutations and copy number loss of ARID2 are associated with cancer progression.
